item.title: ncdu - ncurses disk usage
item.description: At some point harddrive space was cheap, but with the advent of SSDs and cheap “Cloud VMs” that is no longer the case. For example, the cheapest VM on VULTR is $5/month and has a 15 gig SSD drive. It’s suddenly very important to maximize drive usage again. This is where ncdu comes in. It displays a nice ncurses interface that visualizes the usage breakdown. So useful key bindings:

item.title: RAID5: Recovering from 2-drive failure during rebuild
item.description: RAID is amazing technology. It lets us take a bunch of cheap disks an arrange them in various configurations that present these disks as one large disk. A particularly popular type of RAID for home users is RAID5. A RAID5 array is typically comprised of 3 disks, however only 2⁄3 of the disk space is available since 1⁄3 of the space is used for recovery purposes if one of the disks fail.

item.title: tircd, irc twitter gateway
item.description: I published my tircd branch. If you’re unfamiliar with tircd it’s a daemon that presents Twitter as an IRC channel. I merged this really old branch that implements Twitter lists as channels with the semi official google code mirror branch. I created a pull request but it hasn’t been acted on yet. I consume my instant messaging via IRC (with the help of minbif) and now Twitter too. Quite convenient.
